Hi Grace, checking in with you to ask how long you need with the proposal/SoW before I can share with Jen (CHRO) and Kate? I am also still confirming if Marina herself will be at the retreat. If not, the ExecComm number is actually just 10. I think we can assume it's just 10, actually. But fine to leave 11 in the scope for now.
Thank you!!
Tina 
From:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 13, 2023 1:50 PM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
 
Hi Grace, Happy Tuesday! I was out of pocket this AM but back to it. 
🙂
Yes, I assumed BCI is longer for execs but it was written as 2 hours in the proposal and perhaps in the SoW (not remembering exactly). Just to make sure all our i's are dotted before we share this with our President (Olga).
 
In terms of dates - they haven't set a date for the retreat yet. It was actually an idea from Olga to do one this year (I didn't realize it was the first!) and they are looking for programming. So, it's perfect timing. I think we can cross December off our list - that month is too tight with vacations and holidays - will be hard to get people together.  
 
Good news - I have the breakdown:
 
Junior Leadership Committee – 35
Management Committee – 74
Leadership Committee – 33
Executive Committee – 11
 
My recommendation is that you draw up TWO SoW - one where the Leadership Committee goes through IDIs and their own special session of BCI and one where they ONLY do BCI together without IDIs. I am wondering now if we rethink how we split. Do we combine the Junior and Mgmt Committees and offer 3 sessions that way OR do we offer management 2 and junior 1 (so basically have them meet by level?) I do think the top 44 are the ones who will want to go through the microlearnings later on.  But I'd cascade for sure from Exec to Leadership to Management/Junior.  Because I want messaging to trickle from each layer too, about how great the workshops were, how valuable, and we expect you to attend!!
 
I don't know that the last question (whether we offer 3 sessions and have Junior and Mgmt mix OR keep the leadership layers separate) is important today in terms of getting the scope and proposal updated. What do you think?
 
Tina
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Monday, June 12, 2023 6:04 PM
To:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
>
Subject:
 RE: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
 
Hi Tina,
 
I hope you’ve had a nice Monday! 
 
Re timing for BCI – our version for Executives is longer because it includes the Group IDI debrief – however, we frequently adapt to 3 hours rather than 4.
 
It would be amazing to deliver BCI in person for the ExecCom. For this session, we’d want all of them to complete their 1:1 assessments and individual debrief sessions prior to the in-person event. For this session, 3 hours would be ideal – let me know if you think this can work.
 
For the Leadership Committee, my recommendation would be tethered to whether or not they will do the IDI. If we want them to do the IDI, let’s deliver a second version of BCI for Leaders to them. If we do not want to put them through the IDI at this time, it would make sense to do as you recommend and have them join the 4 “All Audience” BCI sessions and have them join Exec Comm for the Disrupting Bias session. I hope this also answers your question about how to approach IDI for the 2
nd
 layer. I am always going to advocate we do IDI when we can, because I think it contributes so deeply to a strong foundation for staff upon which they can build from future DEI conversations and learning opportunities. 
 
I saw your note about numbers for Exec Comm, let me know when you know and we can update the proposal quickly.
 
Based on this information, I’m just wondering if there’s any other dates we might want to tether activities. For example, now we know that the first BCI delivery for Exec Comm could be in Fall, so we’ll want the All audiences roll out to start shortly after. Are there any other specifics that you can predict at this point?
 
Happy to jump on a call tomorrow if it helps.
 
Grace

 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, June 12, 2023 10:11 AM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
Hi Grace!
This is great. In the proposal, on slides 16 & 17 - you indicate that BCI is 2 hours but my notes (and slide 14) shows them both as 4. Is this a misprint? Later, the overview slide for managers (slide 25), again lists it as 4 hours. The overview slide for all audiences correctly lists it as 2. I think 2 hours is perfect. 
 
I've learned that ExecComm (leaders of teams) is attending a retreat in fall (exact date TBD) so there is an opportunity here to run BCI in person for them. I understand it is about 12 people. Exact # to come. I see you've priced out for 15 which is great for now. 
Would you recommend then, that we split up the second tier just below (it's called "leadership committee") across the 4 "All Audiences", and then put them with Exec Comm for Disrupting Bias 
OR 
ask this 2
nd
 layer to attend their own BCI for leaders? 
How does this impact the IDI work for that 2
nd
 layer? On slide 18 you show 27 go through IDI assessments but how do we manage that if only the top ~12 are in person for that BCI session? Also, it shows administration to just these 15 on the SoW. 
Based on this email, what updates (if any) do you need to make to the deck/proposal? I'm happy to forward it on and our CHRO is meeting with Olga (President) today. CHRO and myself are both very excited about the plan - the 12-month pulse esp. and opportunity to run BCI in person for the top 12.
 
Tina
 
  
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Friday, June 9, 2023 5:04 PM
To:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
>
Subject:
 RE: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
 
Hi Tina,
 
We really are! I am attaching two documents – and updated and refined proposal overview with session details, and the draft Statement of Work. This includes the 30% discount being applied for anything 
signed before June 30 
– please let me know if you want me to also share a copy without the 30%.
 
It’s great to confirm the 12-month timing. I think that makes sense. I have included the initial timing by month in the project design, but it would be amazing to talk through and confirm exactly what you had in mind.
 
What you have described sounds great. I want to be sure that for the Leaders, we plan on completion of the IDI and their individual debriefs prior to Building a Culture of Inclusion, since our intention is for the first workshop to include the Group IDI debrief. If you think we should change this, we could talk about mixing it up a bit and doing a deliver of BCI without the IDI and before the test is even administered – but let’s talk that through?!
 
Regarding in-person/virtual – right now, I’ve only applied the on-site premium to the two deliveries of BCI that we’ll do in-person. This means that everything else – so for leaders BCI Part 1 and BCI Part 2/ How to Disrupt Bias When Evaluating Talent – and for all audiences – the other two deliveries of BCI and 4 virtual deliveries of Managing Unconscious Bias in the Workplace (as a note, I recommend this course be deliver virtually). 
 
Please do not hesitate to reach out with questions, edits, etc.
Talk to you soon, and I hope you have a lovely weekend!
 
Thanks,
Grace

 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com

Sent:
 Friday, June 9, 2023 10:05 AM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
Great chat, Grace, we are on a roll!
I've just learned from Jen Schwerin (CHRO), that the suggested timing is a 12-month scope. We ask so much of associates and have so much going on, we can start with the BCI in fall (sept-dec timing) but that the 2
nd
 sessions (and IDI) will follow in 2024. Does that make sense? I like the idea of a pulse versus getting it all done quickly, anyway, and the 2
nd
 session there will be time to pressure test "what have you been doing differently since we last met? How are things now?"
 
We are still figuring out if we do the leadership sessions in person or remotely. Or, maybe a combo, jumping in when they are all in person for another meeting/event.... To me, it makes no difference in person or remote in this post-covid age.
 
Thank you again for putting together the scope/budget/timing.
Tina

subject: Last Call For Project Management Best Practices: The 8 Keys To Bring Every Project In On Time & On Budget
body:
Project Management Best Practices: The 8 Keys To Bring Every Project In On Time & On Budget
Live Webinar | 
Chris DeVany
 
| Jun 15, 2023 , 01 : 00 PM EST | 90 Minutes
Get $29 off. Eligibility Code: 
"SAVE29"
Register Now
 
Description:-
Let's face it - we are all managing projects every day! They may be simple or more complex, but undoubtedly you are managing projects within your role. You don't need to be a project manager to learn how to manage your projects effectively and efficiently. This interactive presentation will provide the basics of managing projects - regardless of their size or complexity. Webinar attendees will be provided a variety of tools, techniques, and best practices to enable them to manage the projects they are assigned and the projects they want to undertake, including how to socialize initiatives to get buy-in from others.
This webinar will provide a simple step-by-step process for managing your projects. Attendees will learn how to use a variety of documents - scope statements, communication plans, risk management plans, risk registers, and change management plans - in order to better manage their initiatives. Additionally, the importance of socializing initiatives as well as managing stakeholders to ensure commitment to initiatives and support needed to achieve goals will be discussed.
Challenges in managing projects will be covered as well as how to best address those challenges to keep your project moving forward. Other topics covered in this webinar to enable increased effectiveness in managing projects and meeting project goals include developing the project business case, effective project planning with the team, five stages of team development, driving decision-making from stakeholders, and facilitating effective team meetings.
Leave this webinar with a better understanding of how project management can assist you in performing your role in your organization.
Areas Covered:-
Project Scope Statements
Developing the business case for your own projects
Identifying and managing stakeholders
Developing your Project Plan
Itemizing your Work Breakdown Structure and activity list
Enhancing your Communications Plan
Identifying, planning, and managing project risks
Managing changes to the project
Reporting on status
Driving decisions from the team and from key stakeholders
Why You Should Attend:-
By attending, you will understand how to do even more effectively:
Scale Project Scope Statements
Develop the business case for your own projects
Identifying and managing stakeholders
Develop your Project Plan
Itemize your Work Breakdown Structure and activity list
Enhance your Communications Plan
Identify, plan, and manage project risks
Manage changes to the project
Report on status
Drive decisions from the team and from key stakeholders
Would you like to get more (or all!) of the projects you manage on time and on a budget?
Are you concerned about people on your project teams not knowing enough about how to effectively manage a project? What about you?
Would you like some help managing your projects more?
Would you like to manage others' expectations?
If you answered "yes" to any of these questions, you should join us!
Or more than 6 attendee call us at +1-877-896-6748 or mail us at cs@ineducator.com
You can choose to stop receiving updates from us 
Unsubscribe Here
Email By:- Ineducators 
7201 Wisconsin Ave Suite 440 Bethesda, MD 20814

Jeffrey Cookson deleted an event: FORUM "Trio of Higher Ed..." Panel 3.22.22 Adding Kendall to the invite   All Times CST   9...
 
 
 
Log in → 
Jeffrey Cookson deleted an event: 
FORUM "Trio of Higher Ed..." Panel
 
3.22.22 Adding Kendall to the invite
 
All Times CST
 
930-10am – join the call in advance of our session
10-1130am – Panel Presentation
1130-1145 – Panelist Debrief 
 
 
PANEL OUTLINE 10:00-11:30 AM CST APRIL 7, 2022
30m – PART 1: Opening
Intros (assumes 3 min late start so 7m total), 
(10m)
Welcome, outcomes, etc (1m)
LCW staff supporting the preso (1m)
Participant Polls (2m)
Panelists (3m – 1m per panelist)
Program Info (6m per panelist), 
(20m)
              Panelists – please answer the following questions from a high level
What need were you solving, was the subject of the learning intervention? (Place that need into a larger institutional context)
Who is the intended audience?
What was/is your development and implementation timeline?
What were your most important factors for vendor selection?
What hurdles did/do you need to overcome, work around or leave unresolved? (please refrain from the hows and whys related to this question until you’re in the breakouts)?
What’s your biggest lesson learned?
46m – PART 2: Breakouts
Migration into Breakouts 
(1m)
Panelists – please revisit 
(6m)
Hurdles overcome, worked around or left unresolved – the hows and whys 
Getting buy-in
Logistic applications
Lessons learned
Free-flow interaction between panelist and participants aided by the LCW project consultant and LCW tech; we’ll make use of any questions posed in advance via Pathable 
(30m)
Participant Reflections 
(9m)
Guided Questions – TBD (2m)
Take-away sharing (6m)
Contact sharing opportunity (1m)
14m – PART 3: Closing
Migration back to plenary group 
(1m)
Breakout recap (by panelists or LCW project manager), (3m per group) 
(9m)
Panelist Final Thoughts (1m each), 
(3m)
Wrap-up 
(1m)

If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

subject: philanthropy inputs!
body:
Explain your relationship with and/or understanding of philanthropy today, and in particular its capacity to build bridges across difference
Future of philanthropy is partnership focused --- that is where impact and potential for culture change lies
LCW has worked with philanthropic organizations including renowned family foundations and multilateral institutions to increase inclusion and understanding 
As a culture-first organization, we use intercultural competencies as a building block for driving culture change
We have partnered with organizations leading culture-wide change (could emphasize J&J or something) and understand from experience the key role that philanthropy holds in transforming communities and societies
Building bridges across difference
Philanthropy holds immense power – and can fail in a way that public funding cannot. Can take the time to be intentional. By that – philanthropy can create a shift by leading the way in community-first philanthropy and project design
First, deeply learning about and understanding – from their own words – the communities 
Then designing fit-for purpose solutions (where most philanthropy gets lost in “bringing the newest/best xyz” to a community, it should be focused on connecting resources with the groups that already support that community, are from that community, and can identify what is needed)
 
 
Advice – don’t add too much about philanthropy (we are not experts as LCW), emphasize the transformative power of philanthropy and the connecftion between LCW’s ability to produce inclusive and culturally competent teams and processes – which will make even greater impact in philanthropy – especially if philanthropy organizations apply this work to their grant/fund recipients
 
 
Can talk about it tomorrow too if there’s anything I can help with!

subject: Registration is Now Open! 2023 Goalmakers Conference & Upcoming Events
body:
REGISTER NOW
 
Early Bird pricing until September 13
 
Nov. 30: Virtual
$75 member and non-member
 
Dec. 7: In-person in Seattle
, also gives free access to virtual
$275 for members
$375 for non-members
 
Upcoming GlobalWA Events
 
 
Storytelling to Leverage Mainstream Momentum, 
Yet Stand out From the Crowd
This workshop by communications and advocacy firm 
APCO Worldwide
, in partnership with GlobalWA, will explore best practices in developing key messages, storytelling themes and differentiators that organizations can use to leverage trending conversations and key moments in the global development space. Learn how to insert your organization into visible and public conversations, influence or spin off new ones, and maintain share of voice over time.
 
This is an in-person, GlobalWA member-only event.
 
Please RSVP to 
comms@globalwa.org
.
This workshop will be hosted by APCO’s Social Impact team and is part of the GlobalWA Communications Collective series. Your APCO workshop hosts will be:
Jennifer Butte-Dahl
Senior Director
APCO
 
Linda Low
Director
APCO
 
Majd Baniodeh
Senior Associate Director
APCO
Who:
GlobalWA Members
Where:
To be announced (Seattle)
When:
June 15, 2023
Time:
3:30pm PT - 5:00pm PT
Cost:
Members: Free
 
Tech Solutions for Climate Action: 
Harnessing Innovation to Address Climate Change
 
Join us for an engaging webinar as we delve into the intersection of technology and climate change, featuring 
David Oswald
, Founder and President from 
DE Design + Environment
.
 
We will explore the transformative role that technology plays in addressing the pressing challenges of climate change. David Oswald, with his vast knowledge and experience in the field, will provide valuable insights into the innovative solutions and approaches that can drive sustainable change.
 
Discover how cutting-edge technologies are revolutionizing our ability to mitigate the effects of climate change, adapt to a rapidly evolving environment, and create a more sustainable future. Through engaging discussions and real-world examples, we will uncover the potential of technology to shape a greener, more resilient world.
 
Participants will have the chance to interact directly with David Oswald, posing questions and engaging in a dynamic dialogue that fuels inspiration and action.
 
Featured Speaker
David Oswald
President and Founder
DE Design + Environment
 
Who:
Everyone
Where:
Zoom Webinar
When:
Wednesday, June 21 ,2023
11:00am – 12noon
Webinar is free to attend but registration is required.
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Building Bridges to Health: 
Advancing Global Access to Quality Healthcare
 
Excited to announce our Q2 Final Mile presenter will be Jesse Greenspan, Managing Director of International Operations with Partners in Health (PIH).  Many of you are familiar with the storied history of Partners in Health.  If you are not or would like to learn more before our event, the narrative of their start in Haiti in 1987 and their crucial role in expanding global health access is captured well in the film “Bending The Arc”  (on Netflix and via PIH website: 
https://www.pih.org/bending-the-arc
 and in numerous books and other publications.  36 years later they continue to grow their impact to communities in 11 countries across 4 continents.  Over the past decade, Jesse has lead PIH supply chain and logistics before overseeing all international operations through the pandemic and with the new challenges we face today.
 
What: 
Q2 Final Mile Logistics Working Group meeting 
 
When:
Wednesday, June 28 – 1 pm PDT / 4 pm EST 
 
Where:
Zoom virtual meeting (link to follow) 
 
Who:
Jesse Greenspan
Managing Director of International Operations,
Partners in Health 
 
Topic:
Building Bridges to Health:
Advancing Global Access to Quality Healthcare

subject: A Preview of the 2023 World Credit Union Conference on Episode 26 of the Global Credit Union Podcast
body:
Read on web
 | 
Unsubscribe
 | Sent to: g.vottero@lcwmail.com
 
The Global Credit Union Podcast - Episode 26: A Preview of the 2023 World Credit Union Conference
Brian Harris, President and CEO of
 
Interior Savings Credit Union
 
in British Columbia, Canada—home to next month’s
 
2023 World Credit Union Conference
—joins us on 
Episode 26 of The Global Credit Union Podcast
 to talk about the vibrant region and, more specifically, the City of Vancouver and all it has to offer the more than 3,000 credit union professionals who will be converging on it from July 23-26.
Plus, with Worldwide Foundation for Credit Unions and its Global Women’s Leadership Network (GWLN) and WYCUP programs 
hosting more events in conjunction with a World Credit Union Conference than ever before
, Mike Reuter, Executive Director of the Worldwide Foundation, joins GWLN Director Lena Giakoumopoulos and WYCUP Manager Ari Farrell to preview
 
those activities.
This episode has all you need to help you get ready for #wcuc2023!
                                       
                                    
You can find past episodes of The Global Credit Union Podcast by
 
clicking here
. To suggest a topic or guest for a future episode, contact Greg Neumann, World Council Director of Communications, at
 
gneumann@woccu.org
.
World Council of Credit Unions
P.O. Box 2982, Madison, WI 53701-2982 USA
Phone: +1-608-395-2000 | Fax: +1-608-395-2001 | 
mail@woccu.org
 | 
www.woccu.org

subject: FW: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
body:
FYI – we can talk about MMC when we connect. This SOW needs one tweak, they’re trying to sign before end of June to get the discount
 
From:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <tina.anderson@hellommc.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, June 14, 2023 2:41 PM
To:
 Grace Vottero <g.vottero@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Re: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
Hi Grace, checking in with you to ask how long you need with the proposal/SoW before I can share with Jen (CHRO) and Kate? I am also still confirming if Marina herself will be at the retreat. If not, the ExecComm number is actually just 10. I think we can assume it's just 10, actually. But fine to leave 11 in the scope for now.
Thank you!!
Tina 
From:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
>
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 13, 2023 1:50 PM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
 
Hi Grace, Happy Tuesday! I was out of pocket this AM but back to it. 
🙂
Yes, I assumed BCI is longer for execs but it was written as 2 hours in the proposal and perhaps in the SoW (not remembering exactly). Just to make sure all our i's are dotted before we share this with our President (Olga).
 
In terms of dates - they haven't set a date for the retreat yet. It was actually an idea from Olga to do one this year (I didn't realize it was the first!) and they are looking for programming. So, it's perfect timing. I think we can cross December off our list - that month is too tight with vacations and holidays - will be hard to get people together.  
 
Good news - I have the breakdown:
 
Junior Leadership Committee – 35
Management Committee – 74
Leadership Committee – 33
Executive Committee – 11
 
My recommendation is that you draw up TWO SoW - one where the Leadership Committee goes through IDIs and their own special session of BCI and one where they ONLY do BCI together without IDIs. I am wondering now if we rethink how we split. Do we combine the Junior and Mgmt Committees and offer 3 sessions that way OR do we offer management 2 and junior 1 (so basically have them meet by level?) I do think the top 44 are the ones who will want to go through the microlearnings later on.  But I'd cascade for sure from Exec to Leadership to Management/Junior.  Because I want messaging to trickle from each layer too, about how great the workshops were, how valuable, and we expect you to attend!!
 
I don't know that the last question (whether we offer 3 sessions and have Junior and Mgmt mix OR keep the leadership layers separate) is important today in terms of getting the scope and proposal updated. What do you think?
 
Tina
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Monday, June 12, 2023 6:04 PM
To:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
>
Subject:
 RE: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
 
Hi Tina,
 
I hope you’ve had a nice Monday! 
 
Re timing for BCI – our version for Executives is longer because it includes the Group IDI debrief – however, we frequently adapt to 3 hours rather than 4.
 
It would be amazing to deliver BCI in person for the ExecCom. For this session, we’d want all of them to complete their 1:1 assessments and individual debrief sessions prior to the in-person event. For this session, 3 hours would be ideal – let me know if you think this can work.
 
For the Leadership Committee, my recommendation would be tethered to whether or not they will do the IDI. If we want them to do the IDI, let’s deliver a second version of BCI for Leaders to them. If we do not want to put them through the IDI at this time, it would make sense to do as you recommend and have them join the 4 “All Audience” BCI sessions and have them join Exec Comm for the Disrupting Bias session. I hope this also answers your question about how to approach IDI for the 2
nd
 layer. I am always going to advocate we do IDI when we can, because I think it contributes so deeply to a strong foundation for staff upon which they can build from future DEI conversations and learning opportunities. 
 
I saw your note about numbers for Exec Comm, let me know when you know and we can update the proposal quickly.
 
Based on this information, I’m just wondering if there’s any other dates we might want to tether activities. For example, now we know that the first BCI delivery for Exec Comm could be in Fall, so we’ll want the All audiences roll out to start shortly after. Are there any other specifics that you can predict at this point?
 
Happy to jump on a call tomorrow if it helps.
 
Grace
 
 
 
From:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, June 12, 2023 10:11 AM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Re: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
Hi Grace!
This is great. In the proposal, on slides 16 & 17 - you indicate that BCI is 2 hours but my notes (and slide 14) shows them both as 4. Is this a misprint? Later, the overview slide for managers (slide 25), again lists it as 4 hours. The overview slide for all audiences correctly lists it as 2. I think 2 hours is perfect. 
 
I've learned that ExecComm (leaders of teams) is attending a retreat in fall (exact date TBD) so there is an opportunity here to run BCI in person for them. I understand it is about 12 people. Exact # to come. I see you've priced out for 15 which is great for now. 
Would you recommend then, that we split up the second tier just below (it's called "leadership committee") across the 4 "All Audiences", and then put them with Exec Comm for Disrupting Bias 
OR 
ask this 2
nd
 layer to attend their own BCI for leaders? 
How does this impact the IDI work for that 2
nd
 layer? On slide 18 you show 27 go through IDI assessments but how do we manage that if only the top ~12 are in person for that BCI session? Also, it shows administration to just these 15 on the SoW. 
Based on this email, what updates (if any) do you need to make to the deck/proposal? I'm happy to forward it on and our CHRO is meeting with Olga (President) today. CHRO and myself are both very excited about the plan - the 12-month pulse esp. and opportunity to run BCI in person for the top 12.
 
Tina
 
  
From:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Sent:
 Friday, June 9, 2023 5:04 PM
To:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
>
Subject:
 RE: MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
 
Hi Tina,
 
We really are! I am attaching two documents – and updated and refined proposal overview with session details, and the draft Statement of Work. This includes the 30% discount being applied for anything 
signed before June 30 
– please let me know if you want me to also share a copy without the 30%.
 
It’s great to confirm the 12-month timing. I think that makes sense. I have included the initial timing by month in the project design, but it would be amazing to talk through and confirm exactly what you had in mind.
 
What you have described sounds great. I want to be sure that for the Leaders, we plan on completion of the IDI and their individual debriefs prior to Building a Culture of Inclusion, since our intention is for the first workshop to include the Group IDI debrief. If you think we should change this, we could talk about mixing it up a bit and doing a deliver of BCI without the IDI and before the test is even administered – but let’s talk that through?!
 
Regarding in-person/virtual – right now, I’ve only applied the on-site premium to the two deliveries of BCI that we’ll do in-person. This means that everything else – so for leaders BCI Part 1 and BCI Part 2/ How to Disrupt Bias When Evaluating Talent – and for all audiences – the other two deliveries of BCI and 4 virtual deliveries of Managing Unconscious Bias in the Workplace (as a note, I recommend this course be deliver virtually). 
 
Please do not hesitate to reach out with questions, edits, etc.
Talk to you soon, and I hope you have a lovely weekend!
 
Thanks,
Grace
 
 
From:
 Tina Anderson (MMC) <
tina.anderson@hellommc.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, June 9, 2023 10:05 AM
To:
 Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 MMC Follow-up: more info for you!
 
Great chat, Grace, we are on a roll!
I've just learned from Jen Schwerin (CHRO), that the suggested timing is a 12-month scope. We ask so much of associates and have so much going on, we can start with the BCI in fall (sept-dec timing) but that the 2
nd
 sessions (and IDI) will follow in 2024. Does that make sense? I like the idea of a pulse versus getting it all done quickly, anyway, and the 2
nd
 session there will be time to pressure test "what have you been doing differently since we last met? How are things now?"
 
We are still figuring out if we do the leadership sessions in person or remotely. Or, maybe a combo, jumping in when they are all in person for another meeting/event.... To me, it makes no difference in person or remote in this post-covid age.
 
Thank you again for putting together the scope/budget/timing.
Tina
 
 
 
This email is intended only for the person or entity to which it is addressed and may contain information that is privileged, confidential or otherwise protected from disclosure. Dissemination, distribution, or copying of this email or the information herein by anyone other than the intended recipient, or an employee or agent responsible for delivering the message to the intended recipient, is prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately.

 session there will be time to pressure test "what have you been doing differently since we last met? How are things now?"
 
We are still figuring out if we do the leadership sessions in person or remotely. Or, maybe a combo, jumping in when they are all in person for another meeting/event.... To me, it makes no difference in person or remote in this post-covid age.
 
Thank you again for putting together the scope/budget/timing.
Tina

subject: RE: Rebranding Updates
body:
She does have the ability to prioritize that deck for sure. The decks will vary by timeline and may alter depending on pop up client work that may come into the pipeline. I think I can work with Keri to create a system where we just commit to something like “2 weeks per facilitation deck” and block out the overall rebranding project accordingly.
 
I have to find the latest and greatest decks for a few on that prioritization list, plus get confirmation on where the latest capability deck is located. Once I heard back from those folks, we can start. Some of these I’m finding multiple copies of on Dropbox so I’m hesitant to pick one and assume.
 
Thanks!
Dustin
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski <j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 13, 2023 3:46 PM
To:
 Dustin Puehler <d.puehler@lcwmail.com>; Grace Vottero <g.vottero@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Rebranding Updates
 
Hey all,
 
Hope you’re doing well! Just wanted to circle back on this – Dustin do you think Keri has the capacity to put the capabilities deck toward the top of her priorities? Also, do we have any sense of how long the facilitated trainings are taking to update so far?
 
Thank you! Let me know if you want to chat!
 
Jake 
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW 
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski 
Sent:
 Friday, June 9, 2023 3:35 PM
To:
 Dustin Puehler <
d.puehler@lcwmail.com
>; Grace Vottero <
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Rebranding Updates
 
Hi Dustin and Grace,
 
Happy Friday! I’ve updated the rebranding SOP to include the two trackers and any changes from our rounds of feedback. Please find the updated SOP attached.
 
Can you please review the SOP and the tracker and provide feedback/make changes as you see fit?
 
I still have one hold in the SOP – the dropbox location of rebranded trainings when they are complete. 
Dustin, could you please touchbase with Keri/Kelly when you get a chance and let us know the best place for those to be placed when they are complete?
 I can add the file path to the SOP when it’s sorted out.
 
One last thing… these are the items that have been flagged by folks as priority non-training materials:
 
High priority:
Capabilities Deck (BD)* top priority
LCW Learning Journeys
 
Lower priority:
SCI One Pager
Onboarding Decks
LCW Leadership Competencies
 
Is there somewhere I should start putting these? Should I just put them in the design tracker along with the first wave of training requests?
 
Thanks for your help with this project – enjoy the weekend!
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski

Marketing & Communications Manager

Hello 
@Michelle Murcia
!
 
At instruction from Randy and Chuck, I have zeroed out Invoice 17240180 and Invoice 17240300 on Scoro. 
 
I have also updated I’ve updated the Comments sections to reflect that this invoice
 is being cancelled and the correct billables are being moved to a different invoice.
 
 
I would like to ask guidance on what to set the Accounting Status as is – right now, both are as 2-In QBO/Unsubmitted.
 
 
I am working on how to invoice the specific amounts requested by Ralph Lauren, and will let you both know when the invoices are ready to go. 
 
Ralph Lauren is understandably confused about how long this has taken– so your help in getting the invoices sent out is hugely appreciated.

Grace

Chuck

Scoro things should be done by Grace. I’d recommend that she comment in the comment section of the invoice something clarifying what is going on to the invoice “This is being cancelled and the correct billables are being moved to a different invoice.”. If she tags Michelle, then Michelle will know she can go into QB and void out the old invoice.  Everything else (re-creating the correct invoices, syncing, sending, etc.) will be the normal process.
-R

m.murcia@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Ralph Lauren
 
I would recommend we empty out both the invoice and Scoro and the invoice in QB – and then generate 2 new invoices and re-sync them to QB.  Modifying in Scoro and then syncing to QB may or may not work as intended – and once an invoice in Scoro is linked to an invoice in QB, it’s gets hard (apparently) to separate them.
 
So, remove the deliverables from the invoice in Scoro and make them billable again. Void out the invoice in QB.  Re-create 2 new invoices in Scoro and sync both to QB – and then submit normally.
 
Thx,
R

Hey, Randy – It’s not $200k. It’s $101,250 to my understanding.
 
I believe that she had two invoices 
(17240180
 for 
$43,500 and 17240300 for $57,750) that she told Sarah had been set to “Ready to Invoice” only to find out later that they hadn’t been (I think this was the David period). Since then RL has determined that they want them billed in different amounts to two new PO that they raised in their Ariba portal to split the costs across profit centers.
 
$73,250 – RL CorpUSA
$28,000 – RL Europe Sarl Switzerland
 
 
The question I had was does it make more sense to delete the two old invoices and create new ones to submit in the Ariba portal? What impact would that have in Compass or QBO? 
 
Does that help clarify?
 
Chuck

Hey Casey,
 
It is great to hear from you! Totally understand, and I’ll be here whenever you want to check-in!
 
I did want to ask you a question so your timing is perfect! I was wondering if you might be able to connect me with the Learning & Development team, or whoever holds the internal learning courses. You all own a perpetual license for one of our courses, Introduction to Managing Unconscious Bias, and we’re introducing a full update and shift in approach to our eLearnings. I would love to connect with whomever at BCG oversees these learnings, so that we can talk them through the implication of the changes.
 
Let me know what you think! Happy to send over more info if helpful.
 
Thank you!
Grace

Hi Grace,
 
I cannot believe 3 months have passed since we connected… I apologize for not following up sooner.
 
We have many internal initiatives going on, so holding off on external sessions. I will definitely be in-touch in a few months to set something up towards the end of the year / plan for 2024!
 
Hope all is well, and that you had a wonderful long weekend!
 
Best,
Casey

 Mitchell, Casey <
Mitchell.Casey@bcg.com
>
Subject:
 LCW follow up
 
EXTERNAL email from: 
g.vottero@lcwmail.com
Hi Casey,
 
It was great to meet you last week! Apologies for a bit of a delay in sharing the attached with you. The PDF includes an overview of LCW’s current content offerings – feel free to share any questions and if a specific topic stands out, I can share more detailed course-specific information.
 
As promised, I am also passing along a few invitations to upcoming LCW events, for you to share with your team.
 
On March 23 at 12 PM CST we’re having the second session of our 
Learning with LCW 
love webinar series
! 
This session, 
Confidently Using LGBTQ+ Language Related to Gender Identity. 
This session provides the opportunity to discuss the dynamic language landscape regarding LGBTQ+ people, their experiences, and their identities, especially as related to diverse gender identities. The discussion will center on how gender identity develops, common ways gender identity is understood by transgender and non-binary people, and the ways allies can demonstrate understanding and empathy—particularly around pronouns, non-binary identities, and gender-neutral language.
Register for this webinar 
here
.
 
We also have a 
live stream
 on International Women’s Day
, March 8
th
 at 11 AM CST
. This is a part of our Brave Conversations with LCW series, and will focus on the International Women’s Day 2023 theme, Embracing Equity. Larry Baker will host and be joined by Alisa Kolodizner (LCW Co-Owner and Managing Partner) and Tamara Thorpe (LCW Principal Consultant) to reflect on their entrepreneurial journeys, including:
Motivations for beginning their career path
Barriers they faced as women in business
Takeaways for supporting women colleagues
 
Don’t hesitate to share any questions as they come up. Hope you have a lovely end to your week!
 
Best,
Grace
 
------------------------------------------------------

 LCW

Hey Casey,
 
It is great to hear from you! Totally understand, and I’ll be here whenever you want to check-in!
 
I did want to ask you a question so your timing is perfect! I was wondering if you might be able to connect me with the Learning & Development team, or whoever holds the internal learning courses. You all own a perpetual license for one of our courses, Introduction to Managing Unconscious Bias, and we’re introducing a full update and shift in approach to our eLearnings. I would love to connect with whomever at BCG oversees these learnings, so that we can talk them through the implication of the changes.
 
Let me know what you think! Happy to send over more info if helpful.
 
Thank you!
Grace

Hi Casey,
 
It was great to meet you last week! Apologies for a bit of a delay in sharing the attached with you. The PDF includes an overview of LCW’s current content offerings – feel free to share any questions and if a specific topic stands out, I can share more detailed course-specific information.
 
As promised, I am also passing along a few invitations to upcoming LCW events, for you to share with your team.
 
On March 23 at 12 PM CST we’re having the second session of our 
Learning with LCW 
love webinar series
! 
This session, 
Confidently Using LGBTQ+ Language Related to Gender Identity. 
This session provides the opportunity to discuss the dynamic language landscape regarding LGBTQ+ people, their experiences, and their identities, especially as related to diverse gender identities. The discussion will center on how gender identity develops, common ways gender identity is understood by transgender and non-binary people, and the ways allies can demonstrate understanding and empathy—particularly around pronouns, non-binary identities, and gender-neutral language.
Register for this webinar 
here
.
 
We also have a 
live stream
 on International Women’s Day
, March 8
th
 at 11 AM CST
. This is a part of our Brave Conversations with LCW series, and will focus on the International Women’s Day 2023 theme, Embracing Equity. Larry Baker will host and be joined by Alisa Kolodizner (LCW Co-Owner and Managing Partner) and Tamara Thorpe (LCW Principal Consultant) to reflect on their entrepreneurial journeys, including:
Motivations for beginning their career path
Barriers they faced as women in business
Takeaways for supporting women colleagues
 
Don’t hesitate to share any questions as they come up. Hope you have a lovely end to your week!
 
Best,
Grace

new client kick off - Kelly/Grace - WomenLift Health
body:
Hi Kelly,
 
We are about to sign an exciting SOW with a new client, WomenLift Health, which will begin with a design and co-creation phase where we will customize / create two workshops for cohorts of executives from different companies/ministries/partners in India, then in North America. 
 
I want to use this call to talk you through it and the Design Team for the project, which I hope will be you and I.
 
Let me know if another time is better for creating 
😊
 
Thanks
Grace

I am working on the updated deck and agenda but it is taking longer than I hoped (just because other client stuff keeps getting in the way) but today looks promising.

Ada

Hi Ada,
 
We are still waiting to hear back from IDB about when they can meet, but in the meantime, I wanted to send you the deck so you can begin preparing. 
 
Keep in mind that in its current form it is 2 hours, so we will be cutting it down to fit into the 90 min allotted time. Also, I want to call out slides 8 and 9, which contain specific examples of microaggressions that we will be tailoring to be more appropriate to the audience once we have our discussions with their team.

subject: RE: Rebranding Updates
body:
Hey all,
 
Hope you’re doing well! Just wanted to circle back on this – Dustin do you think Keri has the capacity to put the capabilities deck toward the top of her priorities? Also, do we have any sense of how long the facilitated trainings are taking to update so far?
 
Thank you! Let me know if you want to chat!
 
Jake 
 
Jake Pieczynski
(he/him/his)
Marketing & Communications Manager
LCW 
 
   
www
 
|
 
Twitter
 
|
 
Facebook
 
|
 
LinkedIn
 
From:
 Jake Pieczynski 
Sent:
 Friday, June 9, 2023 3:35 PM
To:
 Dustin Puehler <d.puehler@lcwmail.com>; Grace Vottero <g.vottero@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Rebranding Updates
 
Hi Dustin and Grace,
 
Happy Friday! I’ve updated the rebranding SOP to include the two trackers and any changes from our rounds of feedback. Please find the updated SOP attached.
 
Can you please review the SOP and the tracker and provide feedback/make changes as you see fit?
 
I still have one hold in the SOP – the dropbox location of rebranded trainings when they are complete. 
Dustin, could you please touchbase with Keri/Kelly when you get a chance and let us know the best place for those to be placed when they are complete?
 I can add the file path to the SOP when it’s sorted out.
 
One last thing… these are the items that have been flagged by folks as priority non-training materials:
 
High priority:
Capabilities Deck (BD)* top priority
LCW Learning Journeys
 
Lower priority:
SCI One Pager
Onboarding Decks
LCW Leadership Competencies
 
Is there somewhere I should start putting these? Should I just put them in the design tracker along with the first wave of training requests?
 
Thanks for your help with this project – enjoy the weekend!
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski

subject: RE: Minnesota Council on Foundations - RUBI RFP File Path, Assignments, & Questions
body:
Hi Hannah,
 
Nassise, Dan, and I had some time to chat about our 2 combined requests (number 2 and 7). Our insights are in the Word doc here:
 
 
We do need to add in a question for Paul about what he means by Community Member. Does that mean people in MCF, Affiliate Company Leaders, Affiliate Company teammates, or just people who live in Minnesota from either a Rural/Urban area…
 
Please, let me know if you have any questions or concerns.
 
Thank you,
 
CW
 
From:
 Hannah Strack <h.strack@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Tuesday, June 13, 2023 9:56 AM
To:
 Nassise Geleta <n.geleta@lcwmail.com>; Conner Williams <c.williams@lcwmail.com>; Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>; Grace Vottero <g.vottero@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Melissa Neu <m.neu@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Minnesota Council on Foundations - RUBI RFP File Path, Assignments, & Questions
 
Hello Everyone, 
 
Thanks for your help in working to get this new proposal out for the RUBI RFP out with such a short timeline! As a reminder, 
all drafts of this proposal are due EOD, Wednesday, June 14
th
 with the 
final submission deadline being Friday, June 16
th
 EOB.
  When your draft is completed, please send it to me and I’ll update it on the new Word Doc. 
 
All documents for the RUBI MCF RFP will still be in the 
Minnesota Council on Foundations file in Dropbox
 
but there is a separate file titled RUBI – Minnesota Council on Foundations
 where all work will be stored. The pathway is shown here: 
 
Each of the assignments for the proposal submission are listed below:
 
Proposal Submission & Eval Assignments
1. Melissa & Hannah
2. Dan, Conner, & Nassise
3. Dan
4. Grace
5. Melissa & Hannah
6. Melissa & Hannah
7. Dan, Conner, & Nassise
8. Melissa & Hannah 
 
In preparation for the call with Paul Masiarchin, the questions we spoke about at the meeting are listed here: 
 
Questions:
 
How will MCF partner with LCW regarding “collecting input from community members”, found in the Purpose of Request section, for the urban and rural populations? Will MCF be drawing on their networks?
Are there any conditions that would preclude LCW from future RFP’s?
 
Please let me know if I’ve missed anything or if you hit any snags in the process and thanks again!
 
Best,
Hannah
